These are misconceptions. Every ADR is guaranteed by a US financial institution which holds equivalent shares of the underlying company."How Do American Depositary Receipts Work?ADRs are denominated in U.S. dollars  with the¬†underlying security¬†held by a U.S. financial institution  often by an overseas branch. ADR holders do not have to transact the trade in the foreign currency or worry about exchanging currency on the forex market. These securities are priced and traded in dollars and cleared through U.S. settlement systems."
